<entry name="AcquireTileDescription" value="Before constructing more buildings, you have to claim new tiles. Click “Acquire Tile” and select a tile with 1 or more building slots."/>
<entry name="BleedDescription" value="Bleed damages ground units each turn. Don't stay inside for too long."/>
<entry name="CameraDescription" value="Welcome to post-apocalyptic Earth. To move the camera, press over terrain and move your mouse."/>
<entry name="CloseQuartersFireDescription" value="Militants have a weapon with Close-Quarters Fire and attack at double rate at range 1. Consider your position before attacking."/>
<entry name="ConstructInfantryBuildingDescription" value="Construct unit production buildings to reinforce your struggling presence. Click “Barracks” and select a valid tile to start construction there."/>
<entry name="CoverDescription" value="Forests, ruins, outposts and cities grant ranged damage reduction for non-large units. Take cover when you can."/>
<entry name="EquipItemDescription" value="click an item to equip it on your hero. Newly equipped items go on a 1 turn cooldown before being usable."/>
<entry name="FoundCityDescription" value="To found your first city, click “Found City” and select a tile."/>
<entry name="HabitationBlocksDescription" value="Each building except the headquarters requires 1 population to operate. It's critical to research and construct Habitation Blocks to increase your city's housing (population limit)."/>
<entry name="HealingDescription" value="The unit has taken significant damage. To heal, it must stay still and not participate in combat. Click “Hold Position Until Healed” to wait until it is back at full strength. Consider retreating to a friendly outpost or city tile where healing is accelerated."/>
<entry name="HousingDescription" value="The city's housing is full. Construct Habitation Blocks to increase the amount of living space and allow your population to grow again."/>
<entry name="LoyaltyDescription" value="Negative loyalty is decreasing the city's resource output. Research and construct a Holo Theater to keep your population working effectively."/>
<entry name="MoraleDescription" value="The unit has taken a hit to morale from the loss of nearby allies. This will reduce their performance in combat. To recover, keep them out of combat or kill enemy units."/>
<entry name="MovementDescription" value="Move the unit by pressing . Each unit can only move once per turn."/>
<entry name="NPCsDescription" value="Three non-player leaders are also fighting for supremacy: Anchorite, Chieftess and ZEPHON. Peace with them allows you to ask for their support. Good standing may unlock additional choices in quests."/>
<entry name="PopulationDescription" value="The city does not have enough population to operate all buildings at full efficiency. You can [] a building icon on a tile to toggle its power at will, freeing 1 population and the building's input resources."/>
<entry name="ProduceUnitsDescription" value="Start Militant production in the Barracks. Other buildings can keep producing at the same time. If you construct more Barracks, units will finish training faster."/>
<entry name="ReconDescription" value="Many units have activatable abilities. Outriders can reveal their surroundings with the Recon ability."/>
<entry name="TheConcordatDescription" value="You can buy and sell resources and hero items at any time at The Concordat."/>
<entry name="TransportsDescription" value="Transports can carry non-large units as cargo. To embark, move onto the transport's tile. Embarked units heal inside, but if the transport is destroyed, the cargo dies with it."/>
<entry name="SelectionDescription" value="click on a unit to select it."/>
